key_drivers: Real yields falling (DFII10 at 1.78%, down from ~2.0%) — primary bullish driver for gold, tech, and risk assets
Crude oil deeply bearish: EIA reported +16.0MB inventory build (week ending Feb 20) with easing supply conditions
NQ STRONG_BULLISH: SOX +1.62% session, MOVE index -4.35% (rate vol collapsing), real yields falling — tech regime intact
RBA surprise hike to 3.85% (Feb 3) and widening AUD-USD rate differential supporting 6A
Eurozone PMI composite 51.9 (Feb, 14-month high) and manufacturing at 44-month high supporting M6E
Geopolitical risk elevated: US 10% global tariffs following Supreme Court ruling, Middle East tensions ongoing

fed_stance.source: CME FedWatch — 98% no-change probability at March FOMC

gold_etf_flows.value: Strong inflows — >$18B YTD, AUM at all-time highs

geopolitical_risk.value: Rising — US 10% global tariffs, Middle East tensions

rate_diff_eur_usd.value: Stable — ECB 2.00% vs Fed 3.50-3.75%, both on hold

eurozone_growth.value: Accelerating — Composite PMI 51.9 (Feb), manufacturing PMI 44-month high

rate_diff_aud_usd.value: Widening — AUD 3.85% vs USD 3.50-3.75%; AUD now higher

china_growth.value: Stable/Mixed — Official PMI 49.3 (weak), private PMI 50.3 (slight expansion)

boj_stance.value: Neutral — Hiking path intact but new dovish board nominees announced

rate_diff_jpy_usd.value: Widening (JPY improving) — BoJ on hiking path, USD/JPY ~155.8

data_quality.notes: All primary sources confirmed. FRED data reflects standard 1-business-day publication lag. VIX and SOX reflect prior session close as US markets are closed at 0235 EST.
